Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial spot causes small, dark, water-soaked lesions on pepper leaves and fruit. Severe infections may lead to defoliation and yield loss.
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.advice: Use certified disease-free seeds, rotate crops, and apply copper-based bactericides when needed.

Pepper__bell___healthy.description: The pepper leaf appears healthy, with a uniform green color and no signs of lesions or wilting.
Pepper__bell___healthy.advice: Maintain regular watering and nutrient balance to keep the plant disease-free.

Potato___Early_blight.description: Early blight, caused by Alternaria solani, results in dark concentric-ring lesions on older leaves and can reduce tuber yield.
Potato___Early_blight.advice: Remove infected leaves, avoid overhead irrigation, and apply fungicides like mancozeb or chlorothalonil as needed.

Potato___Late_blight.description: Late blight is a severe fungal disease caused by Phytophthora infestans, leading to brown, water-soaked spots that spread rapidly.
Potato___Late_blight.advice: Destroy infected plants, avoid excessive humidity, and use resistant varieties when possible.

Potato___healthy.description: Healthy potato foliage is green, turgid, and free from any dark lesions or chlorosis.
Potato___healthy.advice: Ensure proper crop rotation, balanced fertilization, and regular pest management for continued plant health.

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial spot on tomatoes causes small, dark brown lesions on leaves, stems, and fruit surfaces.
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.advice: Avoid working with wet plants, use copper sprays, and practice field sanitation between seasons.

Tomato_Early_blight.description: Early blight causes brown concentric-ring lesions that begin on older leaves and can defoliate plants under humid conditions.
Tomato_Early_blight.advice: Remove affected leaves, avoid leaf wetness, and apply protective fungicides preventively.

Tomato_Late_blight.description: Late blight forms dark, greasy patches on tomato leaves and fruit, often with white fungal growth on the underside.
Tomato_Late_blight.advice: Avoid overhead watering, improve air circulation, and use resistant cultivars or fungicide treatments.

Tomato_Leaf_Mold.description: Leaf mold appears as pale yellow patches on the upper leaf surface with olive-green mold on the underside.
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.advice: Reduce humidity in greenhouses, prune lower leaves, and ensure good airflow. Use fungicides if needed.

Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.description: Septoria leaf spot produces numerous small, circular lesions with dark borders and gray centers on lower leaves.
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.advice: Remove infected leaves, avoid wet foliage, and use a preventive fungicide program.

Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.description: Spider mite infestations lead to fine stippling, yellowing, and webbing on the undersides of leaves.
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.advice: Increase humidity, wash leaves, and use miticides or neem oil sprays as necessary.

Tomato__Target_Spot.description: Target spot causes circular lesions with concentric rings and can lead to premature leaf drop.
Tomato__Target_Spot.advice: Remove infected plant material, avoid dense planting, and apply fungicides for control.

Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.description: This viral disease causes yellowing and curling of leaves, stunted growth, and reduced fruit production.
Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.advice: Control whiteflies (the vector), remove infected plants, and use virus-resistant tomato varieties.

Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.description: The mosaic virus causes mottled, light, and dark green patterns on leaves and may distort fruit shape.
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.advice: Avoid tobacco handling near plants, sterilize tools, and use resistant cultivars.

Tomato_healthy.description: The tomato leaf is healthy, uniformly green, and free from visible disease symptoms.
Tomato_healthy.advice: Maintain balanced fertilization, regular watering, and pest monitoring for ongoing plant health.
